WRITING.TEXT: Well reddit gifts does gift exchanges all year round. I don't know if they would help us do a secret Santa due to the nature of our sub.
Yeah, I'm actually getting treatment quickly because of my low body weight. Some people wait 2 years for treatment in my area
I really want to go into inpatient, but the wait times are really long. So I'll probably end up doing intensive outpatient instead.

Breakfast: Oatmeal with brown sugar and cocoa (147)
Lunch: Simply egg whites with 2 tbsp partially skim mozzarella and sriracha (60), celery (6), red bell pepper (11) and cucumber (8)
Dinner: Whole wheat tortilla, 1 tbsp pizza sauce, 1/4 cup partially skim mozzarella, 1 onion slice and 1 slice of spicy salami (168)
Snacks: Diet coke (0), mio sport (0)
Total: 400 cals
I decided to increase my intake because I need more variety to what I eat and I couldn't get that at the level I was restricting at. It just lead me to binging, so hopefully the new flavours will help stop the binging. I'm also starting to take walks with my mom and my dog in the evenings.
For a while, any food that wasn't part of my strict meal plan would trigger a binge. But I'm working on that
I think it is. I guess the opposite of feeders...

I also thought we could do some sort of secret santa thing, like other subreddits do.
But this is a great idea.

[This](http://imgur.com/a/YZlfx) was me a few weeks ago, [this](http://imgur.com/a/o9Kuu) is me now.
I'm pretty sure I've gained weight which makes me so fricken angry. I've been restricting to below 400 cals and I'm still not losing weight :(

Yup! I've gotten asked for nudes, they kept asking even though I said no.
Also I became friends with a guy who doesn't have an ed, but like to talk to girls who have them. It's really weird and kinda creepy, but he's really nice.

WRITING.TITLE: Increasing intake
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm thinking of increasing my daily caloric intake to around 400 cals, because I need more variety in my meals. But I'm worried it will decrease my weight loss, especially since my weight has plateaued these days. So will this make me gain?
Also if anyone has any low cal recipes I'd love to hear them.

Thanks. I'm safe, I wish I could die, but I can't commit suicide
Thank you!

WRITING.TITLE: Laxatives not working?

WRITING.TITLE: Side effects of your ED
WRITING.TEXT:
We all know that ED take a toll on our bodies and change them. I'm wondering what people have been noticing changing in their bodies because of their ED. Some are positive, others are negative.
I have starting developing lanugo, I'm losing my hair, I'm developing sores on my body (similar to bedsores), I'm having trouble going to the bathroom (tmi), I get really light headed and almost pass out every time I stand up, I'm always cold, if I don't wear enough clothes my hands will go numb and my blood pressure is really low and I have a rapid heart rate
The positive ones for me are losing weight (obvs) and my hyperhidrosis (excessive sweating) is gone.
So what are the side effects you've noticed?
Edit: added more things
I want to reach my ugw before going into recovery, then my next goal is to recover and quit smoking. These aren't really new years resolutions because I'm not starting them at new year's
If you are drinking enough water you shouldn't be retaining water
I'm not even a guy, but that was super inspiring!

WRITING.TITLE: Make sure to get enough salt
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi, I just wanted to remind/tell people to make sure they get enough salt. I often see people recommending people to have more potassium, but salt is just as important. It helps to keep your blood pressure up and helps to keep your muscles, nerves and heart working.
My doctor always emphasizes that I need more salt in my diet when I'm restricting. So I just wanted to let people know that salt is super important and can keep you healthier as you restrict.
I like to put inot my egg whites. Salted cucumbers are really good too.
Plus salt has no calories!
I'm not too sure. I think it's just how it affects me. I've smoked for about 5 years and I only had the munchies for a 1 year period when I was recovered.

I'm so glad I don't get the munchies when I smoke weed, because I'm a daily toker.
I'm sorry to hear about your binge, but you can lose that weight quickly.

I have my assessment at the ed clinic next week and it's making me really nervous. I'm just really anxious about it. I know I need to recover though but I also want to reach my goal. Plus it doesn't help with my anxiety that I won't know my weight until my assessment. I'm worried they'll think I'm still too fat.
Plus, I've been really depressed these past few days and I don't know why. I just don't know what to do with myself anymore
